alert.note: Alert for Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 19 at 2:26PM MST until November 19 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. As rain continues to transition to snow as colder air works in behind a cold front, confidence continues to increase regarding accumulating snowfall in the valleys with moderate to at times heavy snow possible. Lower elevation snowfall amounts are expected to be highest around Pocatello and Bannock County including further south and east into the Southeast Highlands where around 1 to 3 inches of snow is possible with locally higher totals on the benches. * WHERE...In and around Pocatello and surrounding higher terrain. Locations like Blackfoot, Shelley and Fort Hall may see little to no accumulations. Higher accumulations may be very localized over the next few hours. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Motorists should plan ahead for winter travel conditions and allow for extra time to reach their destination.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands
